The scoring sheet requires some revision in my opinion, since no decisions are 'correlated' => so for example, if you choose 3 different file systems with maintainability (+), in the end, it is more like to have an overall maintainability of (--), compared to a single system with maintainability (-). On the scoring sheet however, these 3 systems would yield an maintainability of (+++), which does not reflect the real world.

column8: The consistency dissapeared because some decisions we had to made contradicted others but added the right values to our stack. For example we had to agree with one gaping hole in security because it had only one minus for security and a lot of plusses for all the other parts. Because we already had a lot of security plusses we choose that option but all the other security measures where invalidated because of this choice. The scoring doesn't really reflect that.
